meanings.definition: To manufacture or construct in advance, especially in standardized sections for easy assembly.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to prefabricate the walls of the house before bringing them to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The furniture company will prefabricate the cabinets in their factory to save time on-site.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to watch the workers prefabricate the entire playground structure in just one day.
meanings.sent4: The idea of prefabricating the entire bridge off-site seemed like a bold move, but it paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The concept of prefabrication made the construction process much more efficient and cost-effective.

meanings.definition: To produce or create something in a factory or other manufacturing facility before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: The bakery decided to prefabricate the cake layers to speed up the decorating process.
meanings.sent2: The company will prefabricate the car parts to ensure they are ready for assembly.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the team prefabricate the entire event stage in just a few hours.
meanings.sent4: The decision to prefabricate the components off-site saved a significant amount of time during construction.
meanings.sent5: The ability to prefabricate complex structures revolutionized the manufacturing industry.
